website_summaries.verdict: I wish this camera-floodlight had more robust Alexa and Google Assistant integrations, but it's a decent choice if you want to easily link your outdoor lighting to a live streaming HD security camera.
pros: The Maximus Camera Floodlight comes with free two-hour cloud storage, optional person alerts and detection zones (with a monthly subscription plan) and delivered prompt motion alerts to my phone
cons: This camera responds to Alexa and Google Assistant voice commands, but only adjusts the built-in floodlights -- it won't show a live video feed on a screen-outfitted Amazon or Google smart display
I got some "phantom" motion alerts when bugs flew by and when shadows shifted around throughout the day

customer_reviews.title: Read BBB and negative reviews before buying
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. The camera is junk. The customer service is close to non-existent. Check the BBB ratings. On the upside, the installation and set up was an ease. The picture quality and connection is great. You will get missed notifications or no notifications at all of people or vehicles within the range. I probably would have continued to work with the company if the customer service would have responded and tried to provide a tech resolution. I would say that Ring is better than this in several ways. The customer service at Ring is beyond compared to Kuna.

customer_reviews.title: Not that great. Looking at Momentum Aria as it has all the features and I have their garage cam

Motion sensor doesn’t work very well even set to maximum it missed events or recorded when nothing was happening. One nice thing is that free cloud recording appears to be 4 days but still advertised as 2 hours only. The only purchase option is for 30 days and I show as having no plan. If they are trying to compete with momentum they should probably advertise this change. Also looks like there isn’t a limit on downloads.

customer_reviews.title: Easiest/simpilest install yet.
customer_reviews.text: Easiest of all their lights to install, I have 4 of their porch lights and this flood light is really ten times easier to install. Two wires to splice and a simple twist lock mount for the housing takes literally a minute or two. Lights and sensor are very easy to adjust however and I found no way to tighten them down once adjusted. I worry what they will do in high wind but so far they haven't moved. Light brightness adjustment in the app preview is a very nice addition.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Francis

customer_reviews.title: Was great!  Now it is dead.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product last year. Honestly, I thought it was great. However, just after the 1-yr warranty went out, the motion sensor filled with water after a rain. The light is attached under the overhang of the roof. So, I am not even sure how it got much water. But, it is clearly not weather secure. So, now I am out of warranty, and the entire light and camera are dead. All this after I put in an extra access point to be closer to the light. Very frustrating. I see other reviews that have the same issue. I would not recommend.

I also have 6 additional cameras that are not Kuna, I have a business that I need cameras on the building and the parking lot. The Kuna work great at my House and I can get notifications when people come and go. I am extremely happy with the Kuna lights. customer_reviews.title: DOESNT DETECT MOTION, USELESS.
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 Kuna products (2x Toucan, 1x Floodlight and 1x Maximus). They worked great... for about 6 months. We recently had a windstorm here that caused a lot of false motion detections. Now none of my cameras will detect any motion even with the sensitivity set to 100 (or 25 on AI detect). Even though I am a paying subscriber I suspect they flag accounts that use a lot of bandwidth or server space and make them not work. I was satisfied with their service until the last few weeks. Now I'm debating taking all of them down and going with Ring or Nest. I contacted their support and received nothing back. Do not recommend.

Maybe I got a defective one but I saw tons of bad reviews, and thought I’ll give it a chance. I’m sorry but it’s a bad design. I’m returning it and getting some Sengled flood lights with camera instead.
